He went to school through the fourth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Tete in order to fulfill his military service. He retired from the military after 20 years and earns a pension of 6,800 meticals a month. He uses the pension to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his fourth loan, in the amount of 16,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sand, stone, cement, rebar, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 4,000, 8,500, and 12,500 meticals, were all also used for his home. He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so he can finish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, stone, cement, rebar, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Vilanculos, na provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos todos ainda frequentam a escola. Fez 6ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal a em busca de melhores condições de vida, é fotógrafo ha mais de 5 anos e tem um salario de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao de construcao de uma casa (areia, ferro, pedra, cimento, barrotes, e outros.) para continuar com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Fernando was born in Vilanculos, in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children, all of whom attend school. He went to school through the sixth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Vilanculos in search of a better life. He's been a photographer for more than five years and earns about 12,000 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his first loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sand, iron, stone, cement, rebar, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so he can finish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, iron, stone, cement, rebar, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase home construction materials (sand iron, stones, cement, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Telma

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a escola. Fez 10ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é comerciante ha mais de 2 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 5.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, arroz, amendoim,sumos, peixe, e outros.) para aumentar o volume do negocio.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para ampliar a sua actividade comercial e construir um salão,irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo city, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique, the borrower is a widow and the mother of a son who goes to school. She completed Grade 10 but did not continue as it was too expensive. She lives in her own house with her family, and supports her parents by sending money to assist with their expenses.

She has never left her homeland. She has been running a small business for more than two years and earns about 5,000 MT (Mozambican Meticals) per month. She uses this for household expenses and saves some in her bank account.

She has never had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 15,000 MT. With the loan she will buy more products (oil, rice, peanuts, juices, fish, and others) to increase the volume of business.

In the future she will try to grow her business and build a space for it. She will ask for more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: buy products for sale (oil, rice, peanuts, fish and other items.)

loans.name: Manessa

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 maiores de idade e um ainda frequenta a escola. Fez 5ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é comerciante ha mais de 5 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 8.500.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar cerveja E refrescos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para ampliar a sua actividade comercial e construir uma casa,irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo city, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique, the borrower is single and the mother of three children. Two are adults, and one still attends school. She completed Grade 5 and did not continue due to lack of funds. She lives in her own home with her family and supports two nephews who live with her.

She has never left her homeland. She has run a small business for more than five years and earns about 8,500 MT (Mozambican Meticals) per month. She uses this money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account.

She has never had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 12,000 MT. With the loan she will buy beer and soft drinks to increase the amount of goods in her small shop.

In the future she will try to grow her business and build a house. She will ask for more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Grande

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  provincia de Tete, norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 7 filhos dos quais 5 maiores de idade e 2 ainda frequentam a escola. Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal em missão de serviço, é pensionista militar ha mais de 18 anos e tem uma pensão de 4.571.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu QUINTO emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao de uma casa (ferro, chapas, cimento, pedra, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.600.00mt, 11.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt, e 14.000.00mt todos para a mesma finalidade.
 No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e oferecer conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Grande was born in Tete Province in northern Mozambique. He is married and has seven children; five of them are grown, and two still attend school. Grande finished fourth grade and did not continue school because of financial problems. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

He left his hometown on a work assignment. Grande has been retired from the military for more than 18 years and has a pension of 4,571 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is his fifth Hluvuku loan; he is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy home construction materials (iron, metal sheets, cement, stone and other items) so he can continue building his house. The previous loans were for: 8,600 meticais; 11,000 meticais; 7,000 meticais; and 14,000 meticais, all for the same purpose.

In the future Grande intends to ask for more money to finish his house and make his family comfortable, so he will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for a house (iron, metal sheets, cement, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Arlindo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1 filho que ainda frequenta a escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma enteada enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nos estudos. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é refretário na empresa DICKSON Moçambique ha mais de 6 anos e tem um salario de 8.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de de construcao de uma casa (areia, ferro, chapas, cimento, pedra, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt para a sua obra.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para ampliar a sua casa e oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the town of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. He is married and has a son who still goes to school. He completed 7th grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns. He also supports his stepdaughter by sending money to help with her education.
He has never left his homeland. He has worked in refractory services for Dickinson Mozambique for over six years and earns a salary of 8.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase house construction supplies (sand, iron, metal sheets, cement, stone, etc.) so that he can keep building. The first loan was for 10.000mt to build his house.
In the future, he plans to request more money in order to enlarge his house and offer more comfort to his family. He will request other loans to Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase house construction supplies (sand, iron, metal sheets, cement, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase house construction supplies (rafters, iron, sand, cement, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Elicha

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteiro e não tem filhos. Frequenta a Univercidade Pedagógica e está no 1º ano de psicologia. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus irmãos que vivem com ele. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é professor ha mais de 2 anos e tem um salario de 5.050.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de de construcao de uma casa (barrotes, ferro, areia, cimento, pedra, e outros.) para dar continuidade sua obra.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir os seus estudos para melhorar as condições de vida da sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Elicha was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. He is single and has no children and is in his first year studying psychology at the Universidade Pedagógica. He has never left his hometown and he lives at home with his family and supports his brothers and sisters who also live with him. 

He is a teacher and has earned a monthly salary of 5,050 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] for two years, which goes to his household expenses and also some savings in his personal bank account.  

He has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 10,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which he plans to buy construction materials (bricks, steel, cement, etc.) so she can continue working on his house. 

He plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku in the future to finish his studies and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, steel, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr: Monsieur  Mame  vit au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 34 ans. Il s’active depuis plus de 10ans dans le commerce. Il gère une boutique d’alimentation générale et vend des denrées alimentaires de toute sorte. Il a hérité cette activité de son père.  Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2006. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées en particuliers de nouveaux produits pour les besoins de son commerce. Son objectif est de renforcer son fond de commerce pour mieux développer ses activités,  accroitre ses bénéfices et faire face a ses charges de chef de famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mame lives in Senegal. He is 34 years old and has been active for over ten years in commerce. He manages a grocery store and sells provisions of all kinds. This business was passed down to him by his father. 

Mr. Mame has been an associate of a U-IMCEC branch since October 2006. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 for buying grocery items, new products in particular, for business purposes. 

His goal is to bolster his working capital to develop his business further, to increase his profit, and to meet his responsibilities as head of household.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Madame Aby est une matrone  a la retraite qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est veuve et  évolue dans le secteur du commerce, en particuliers dans  la vente  de thioups, wax, vaisselle, encens  et savon. Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans son activité. Madame Aby est en retraite et ne veut pas rester oisive sans rien faire. C’est la raison pour laquelle elle a choisi cette activité de commerce qui lui permet de se procurer des revenus et  de  compléter sa pension de sorte qu’elle pourra couvrir ses dépenses familiales. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de marchandises qu’elle commercialise. Son souhait est de maximiser ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Ms. Aby is a trained midwife in retirement who lives in Senegal. She is a widow and works in commerce, particularly in selling thioup cloth, wax cloth, pots and pans, incense, and soap. She has two years of experience in this business. Ms. Aby is a retiree but does not want to remain idle with nothing to do. For this reason, she chose this work in commerce that allows her to have an income and to round out her pension. In this way, she will be able to cover her family expenses. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying merchandise that she sells. Her wish is to maximize her profits.

loans.use: to buy thioup and wax fabrics, pots and pans, and other goods to resell

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou est un homme marié de 59 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il est marabout de profession mais  s’active en même temps dans la vente d’habits(Thioups) et de téléphones. Il a une expérience de 20 ans dans son activité. Il a choisi cette activité par opportunité, et ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les gains financiers. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2002. Il a déjà remboursé 11 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour le règlement d’une commande de thioups qu’il aurait reçu. Son objectif est de renouveler son stock  pour répondre à la demande  de la clientèle  en ces veilles de fête. Son souci  est d’améliorer  le niveau de ses profits.
texts.en: Mr. Mamadou is a 59-year-old married man who lives in Senegal. He is a traditional healer by profession but is active at the same time in selling clothing (of thioup cloth) and telephones. He has 20 years of experience in this work, which he chose by chance. Most interesting to him are the financial gains. He has been an associate of a U-IMCEC branch since June 2002. He has already repaid eleven previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for settling a bill for an order of thioups that he would have received. His goal is to renew his stock of goods to respond to customer demand as the holidays approach. His concern is to improve his level of profit.

loans.use: to buy "thioup" cloth to resell

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa, tiene 30 años vive en concubinato, tienen 4 hijos pequeños los  cuales dependen de sus ingresos, viven en la comunidad de Esquilan Chico en una pequeña casa, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta con 2 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción y una cabeza de ganado preñada, la  leche vende a PIL, que es una empresa dedicada a la fabricación de productos lácteos.
El destino del crédito es para la compra de un tanque de enfriamiento, dicha compra se está realizando por un grupo de personas los cuales no contaban con un tanque para acumular la leche, actualmente existe otro tanque,  pero es demasiado lejos para transportar la leche y depositarla alli, con la compra de dicho tanque se beneficiaran todo el grupo porque se instalara en la zona.
 Entre sus sueños y metas es, en futuro contar con una granja pequeña, y realizar una nueva construcción de su domicilio ya que la tiene la construcción está en mal estado.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa, 30, has a spouse and four small children who depend on her income.  They live in the community of Esquilan Chico in a small house.  Her main activity is raw milk production.  She currently owns two heads of dairy cattle in production and one pregnant cow.  She sells the milk to PIL which is a firm dedicated to manufacturing dairy products.

The loan is to buy a cooling tank.  This purchase is being undertaken by a group of people who did not have a milk storage tank.  Currently, there is another tank in existence but it’s too far away to transport the milk there to be stored.  The purchase of said tank will benefit the entire group because it will be installed in the area.

Among her dreams and goals for the future are to have a small farm and start to build a new house because the one she has built now is in poor condition.

loans.use: to pay her share of a raw milk cooling tank.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 28 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y cuatro hijos.

El señor José se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza, engorde y venta de cerdos, él los compra de 22 días de nacido y luego los cuida para poder venderlos bien. Antes el se dedicaba a la agricultura como jornalero, incluso hoy en día también trabaja en eso, además del cuido de los cerdos.

El debe comprar concentrado para alimentar a sus cerdos, para esto debe trasladarse hasta la ciudad en busca de ellos.

Don José quiere seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para la compra de cinco cerdos pequeños, concentrado de inicio y concentrado de engorde, así como fertilizantes para la milpa. Con esto don José podrá recibir mejores ingresos, lo que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, al mismo tiempo estaría incrementando la cantidad de la crianza de cerdos. Él es un cliente recurrente de la fundación y ha pagado a tiempo sus cuotas, ya que de este rubro se obtiene un buen margen de ganancias.

Don José espera seguir en la crianza de los cerdos, quiere comprar una novilla e instalar la luz en su casa, así como hacer un galera para tener mas cerdos y reparar el techo de la granja.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old.  He lives with his life partner and their four children.  For the last four years José has been raising pigs to sell.  He buys them when they are 22 days old and then cares for them in order to sell them well.  Before, he used to work as a day worker in farming and today he still does that besides taking care of the pigs.  He needs to buy feed concentrate to feed his pigs and to do so he must travel to the city in search of it.

José wants to continue working to support his family so he’s asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy five piglets, the starting concentrate and fattening concentrate as well as fertilizer for his corn crop.  With this, José will be able to earn better income that will allow him to improve his family’s quality of life while at the same time he’d be increasing the number of pigs he’s raising.

He’s a returning client of the Fundación and has made his installment payments on time because he earns a good profit margin from this line of work.  He hopes to continue raising pigs.  He wants to buy a young heifer and install electricity in his house as well as to build corrals to have more pigs and to repair the farm’s roof.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Del Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Mujeres Unidas del Divino Niño Jesús, se formó gracias a la iniciativa D. una D. las miembros, la cual había escuchado sobre el programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación Paraguaya. Después D. esto formó a sus amigas y vecinas D. lo que surge el grupo. Todas ellas se unieron con el propósito D. mejoras sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Andresa, ella tiene una mercería, donD. venD. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser prendas D. vestir, artículos para regalo y otros. Mediante su negocio, el cual le genera sus ingresos, ella pueD. mantener a su familia y a quienes D. ella dependen. Comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compran D. ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. artículos para regalos, prendas y otros artículos para abastecer su local y D. esa forma poder cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This committee, named “United Women of the Divine Child Jesus,” was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members, who had heard about the program for enterprising women promoted by the Paraguay Foundation. Afterwards, she got together with her friends and neighbors to create what became the group. All the women united around the proposal of improving their condition of life and that of their families.

One of the members is Andresa who has a notions shop where she sells all sorts of articles, including items of clothing, gift articles, and other things. By means of the store, which generates her income, she can maintain her family and all those who depend on her. Andresa comments that she has a well-developed clientele who always buy from her.

Andresa requests the loan to buy gift articles, items of clothing, and other items to supply her shop, and in this manner, to be able to satisfy her customers. She is very grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity it provides.

loans.use: buy gift merchandise, including women's garments, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca tiene 71 años, es casada, tienen 5 hijos los cuales son independientes, doña Francisca a pesar de su edad sigue trabando con la ayuda de sus hijas, vive en la comunidad de Esquilan Chico, en la provincia de Quillacollo, del departamento de Cochabamba. Su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda, actualmente cuenta con 10 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción, el producto entrega a PIL, una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos.
El destino del préstamo es para la compra de un tanque de enfriamiento, dicha compra se está realizando por un grupo de personas los cuales no contaban con un tanque para acumular la leche, o si tenían otro tanque les quedaba muy lejos, entonces un grupo de personas decidió comprar un tanque con lo cual se beneficiaría todo la zona.
Uno de sus sueños es seguir creciendo en su actividad hasta llegar a tener una pequeña granja de por lo  menos 30 cabezas que pueda pasar al manejo de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Francisca is 71 years old, is married, and has five adult children. In spite of her age, Francisca is able to continue working with the help of her children. She lives in the town of Esquilan Chico, in the Quillacollo province, in the Cochabamba department. Her main business activity is the production of raw milk. Currently she has 10 head of dairy cattle. She delivers the product to PIL, a factory that makes dairy products. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy a cooling tank. This purchase is being made by a group of people who do not have a tank for collecting milk or who have another tank that is too far away. So the group decided to buy a tank that could benefit everyone in the area. 

One of her dreams is to continue growing her business until she has a little farm with at least 30 head of cattle that she can pass on to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy a cooling tank for raw milk with a group of people

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo tiene 57 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, tres de sus seis hijos, y un nieto. Sus tíos le enseñaron a ganarse el pan de cada día como agricultor, y actualmente tiene 20 años de desempeñar esta labor. Anteriormente el trabajaba como jornalero.

Para comprar sus insumos don Leonardo debe caminar cinco kilómetros y luego abordar un bus que recorre otros dos kilómetros. Luego, él paga un carro para que lo lleve a su casa ya con los productos comprados. El viaje completo demora mas o menos tres horas ida y vuelta. Este viaje lo hace dos veces al año, en mayo y agosto, cuando es época de cultivación.

Don Leonardo esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de una yunta de bueyes, debido a que se aproxima la temporada de recolección de las cosechas de maíz que el produce. Con la nueva yunta de bueyes él podrá sacar la cosecha de manera mas rápida, ya que podrá sacar el doble de producto en un solo viaje. Adicionalmente, con la nueva yunta Don Leonardo prestará sus servicios de acarreo y arado de tierra a las personas de su comunidad. Con mayor eficiencia, y los ingresos adicionales mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia. De igual forma, él siente que ayudará a las personas de su comunidad prestándoles un servicio que les ayudará a tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 57 years old, lives with his life partner, three of their seven children, and one grandson. His uncles taught him to earn his daily bread as a farmer, and now he has been doing that work for 20 years. Previously he worked as a day laborer.

To buy his supplies, Leonardo must walk five kilometers and then get on a bus that goes another two kilometers. Then, he hires a car to take him to his house along with his purchases. The entire journey takes about three hours round trip. He makes this trip twice a year, in May and August, when it’s planting season. 

Leonardo is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a team of oxen for the upcoming corn crop that he grows. With the new team of oxen he will be able to harvest the corn more quickly which means he will be able to double his product in one trip. Also, with the new oxen Leonardo will rent his hauling and plowing services to people in the community. With more efficiency and additional income he will improve the quality of life for his family. By the same token, he feels he will help the people of his community by providing them a service that will help them get more income.

loans.use: to buy a team of oxen

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Emprendedoras" se originó a través de promociones que fue hecho en el barrio. Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa. Desean poder crecer no solo económicamente sino también en lo personal.
Una de las miembros es la señora Raimunda, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, mediante lo cual puede ayudar en los gastos de la casa y en la manutención de la familia. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes,pues tiene una sazón deliciosa. Así también nos dice que le gustaría poder seguir con esto e ir creciendo día a día gracias a su trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, harina, huevos y otros, los cuales son insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que ella vende.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women) committee was created as a result of promotional work that took place in their neighborhood.  All the members of the group are from the same area.  They are neighbors and acquaintances from the same neighborhood.  The aims of each and every one of them are to work, to promote a supportive spirit within their group and to reach the top level of the program.  They would like to grow not only financially but also on a personal level.

One of the members of this group is Raimunda whose business is selling food.  This work enables her to help cover her household expenses and help support her family.  She tells us that she has a lot of customers because her food tastes delicious.  She also tells us that she would like to be able to continue in the program and continue growing every day thanks to her work.

Raimunda is requesting a loan to buy meat, chicken, flour, eggs and other products which are the supplies she needs to make the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Angelita Maritza

texts.es:
Angelita mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, comerciante, sus hijos estudiantes. El mayor proyectó  que tiene es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda así su familia tendrá protección y seguridad.
Con el préstamo compra mercadería para vender como: lotería, raspadita entre otros productos. Que comercializa siendo el generador del sustento de su familia. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a mejorar su nivel de vida y el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking and enterprising merchant, and her children are students. Her main project is to improve the infrastructure of her home so that her family will have protection and security. 

With the loan she will buy merchandise to sell such as lottery scratch-offs and other items that she sells to be the breadwinner for her family. She thanks the lender for the support to improve her quality of life and to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase lottery ticket merchandise

loans.name: Nancy Estela

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es de la ciudad de Encarnación, ella es una clienta recurrente de la Fundación, siempre cumple muy bien con sus obligaciones.
Se dedica a la venta de prendas para damas y caballeros, este es su medio de subsistencia y la de su familia. Ella comenta que todos los días empieza a muy tempranas horas su jornada de trabajo, regresando muy tarde ya a su casa. Dice que este trabajo la ayuda a poder salir adelante y darle a su familia una vida digna y decorosa. Quiere continuar con su negocio, por lo que quiere seguir invirtiendo en el.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual podrá cumplir las demandas de clientes. Agradece a la Fundación, por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Nancy is from the city of Encarnación.  She is a returning client of the Fundación [Paraguaya], and always fulfills her obligations very well.

Nancy sells clothing for women and men.  This is her means of support and that of her family.  She says that she begins her work day very early every day, returning home when it is already very late.  This work helps her to be able to get ahead and give her family a proper and honorable life.

She wants to continue with her business, which is why she wants to continue investing in it.

Nancy is requesting the loan to buy all types of clothes so she will be able to fulfill her customers' orders.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it is offering her, since receiving the loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 23 years old, married, has one dependent child, and lives in the town of Esquilan Chico in a small house. Her main business activity is producing raw milk. Currently she has three head of dairy cattle. She sells the milk to a factory that makes dairy products. 

The loan is to buy a cooling tank. This purchase is being made for a group of people who do not have their own cooling talk to collect all their milk. There is another tank but it is located very far away. The purchase of this new tank will benefit everyone. 

Among her dreams is, in the near future, to have a small farm with many dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy a cooling tank for raw milk with other farmers.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor Javier tiene 44 años de edad y vive en una casa propia que comparte con de sus hermanos domicilio que esta ubicado en el barrio Lourdes de la ciudad de Tarija. Javier es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 13 años a quienes cuida y apoya en su educación y estudios. El señor Javier se dedica desde hace más de 10 a trabajar como empleado público. Y los fines de semana a la preparación de comidas para ocasiones especiales como ser cumpleaños, bautizos, matrimonios y otros eventos. Javier  quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto a su familia, pero él nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar un mejor equipo para poder preparar las comidas porque el que tiene esta pequeño. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de estos equipos, para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        Javier nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para ampliar la actividad que tiene.
texts.en: Javier is 44 years old and lives in his own house which he shares with his brothers household and which is located in the Lourdes neighborhood in the city of Tarija. Javier is married and has two children who are 20 and 13 years old and who he cares for and supports in their education and studies. Javier has been working for more than 10 years as a public employee. On the weekends he makes food for special occasions like birthdays, baptisms, and other events. Javier would like to have more income in order to move forward together with his family, but he says that he has to buy better equipment to be able to prepare food because what he has now is small. It’s for this reason that the loan is for the purchase of that equipment because that way he can increase his income. Javier says that he wants to improve his living conditions, and for this reason he says that the next loan he asks for will be to expand the business he has.

loans.use: to buy equipment to prepare food for social events

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 21 años de edad, muy luchador con muchos sueños que cumplir, él vive con su mamá.

Él desde pequeño le ha tocado trabajar, a sus ocho años de edad empezó a trabajar en la agricultura y fue su tío quien le enseño, ya que sus padres se separaron, por tener que trabajar para ayudar a su mamá él solo logro estudiar hasta el cuarto grado, aprendiendo lo necesario de leer y escribir, luego el salio de su hogar a la edad de 16 años en busca de su papá a la ciudad, allí lo encuentra y él le enseña a manejar en un carro que tenia para hacer viajes a otras personas y cobrar por ese servicio, de esta forma el fue ganando experiencia como motorista, a los 18 años el inicia a trabajar como motorista de camiones que trasladan madera a distintas partes del país, él maneja durante cinco horas para entregar los fletes de madera, para esto él debe cargar el camión por la tarde de 6:00 p.m. a 10:00 p.m. una vez cargado sale a las 3:00 a.m. de la madrugada a dejar la madera. 

Él desea emprender esta actividad de manera independiente, comprar la madera e irla a distribuir a mejores precios, por su propia cuenta, es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito a Fundación Campo. Con esto él recibirá mejores ingresos y será una gran oportunidad para seguir luchando y proporcionarle a su familia algo mejor, ya que el desea ahorrar para comprarse un camión, ya que el trabajar de manera independiente es su visión.

El desea ser un ejemplo para otros jóvenes, que con esfuerzo se puede alcanzar todo en la vida, solo basta trabajar y proponerse metas.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man of 21 who is very determined, with many dreams to fulfill. He lives with his mother. He has had to work from a young age. At the age of eight he began to work in farming; his uncle taught him, since his parents were separated. 

Because of having to help his mother, he only managed to attend school to fourth grade, learning the basics of reading and writing.  Then he left home at 16 to look for his father in the city. He found him there, and his father taught him to drive a car that he owned, so that he could take people on trips, and charge for that service. In this way, he started to gain experience as a driver. 

At  the age of 18, he began to drive the trucks that transport wood to different parts of the country. He drives for five hours to deliver the shipments of wood. To do this, he has to load the truck in the evening from 6:00pm to 10:00pm. Once loaded, he leaves at 3:00am to drop off the wood. 
 
He wishes to undertake this work on an independent basis; buying the wood and distributing it at better prices on his own. That is why he is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan. In this way, he will receive a better income. It will be a great opportunity to continue working hard, and to provide his family with a better life; as he wants to save to buy his own truck, since his vision is to work independently. 

He wishes to be an example for other young men, who with effort can achieve everything in life; they only have to work and set goals.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Mujeres Maravilla Group

texts.es:
La formación de este comité fue gracias a la señora Adelaida, pues ella contactó con sus amigas y vecinas del barrio y las organizo, y de allí surge el comité. Ellas son en total 21 mujeres, las cuales trabajan de forma coordinada, conjunta y dentro de un ambiente de respeto.
La señora Adelaida se dedica a la venta de cosméticos hace ya un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada, pues siempre muchas mujeres le hacen pedidos de los cosméticos que vende. Comenta que tiene mucha demanda por lo que le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en su pequeño emprendimiento. Además de eso nos dice que por medio de este trabajo ella ha logrado mantener y sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, para que pueda surtirse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Adelaida, who contacted her friends and neighbors in the neighborhood and organized them to form the group.  They are 21 women in all who work in a coordinated and unified manner, and in a respectful environment.

Adelaida has been selling cosmetics for a long time already, and because of this she already has a well-established clientele, since many women always order cosmetics from her.  She comments that because she has lots of orders she would like to continue investing in her small business.  She also tells us that she has been able to support her family and get them ahead with this job.

Adelaida is requesting the loan to buy cosmetics so she can stock her business and fulfill her customers' orders.  She thanks the Fundación [Paraguaya] for the opportunity it is offering her, since obtaining the loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Luisa Ercilia

texts.es:
Doña Luisa, cuenta con su propio negocio, un comedor desde hace veintidos años, el cual ha venido creciendo, al trabajar con dedicacion en su negocio para el apoyo economico de su familia, su esposo se desempeña en administracion de empresa, el cual ha apoyado con el dinero de su labor.
Es madre de tres hijos, uno casado y dos estudiante de la universidad, doña luisa, ha sido muy trabajadora, comenzo con la venta de fritanga , lo que con los años, puso su comedor con las ganancias y luego con financiamiento en Afodenic, logro ampliar a comedor, su especialidad en comida es el pollo asado al horno, pues se ha hecho gustar muchos por los clientes.
Con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de docientas cincuenta libra de pollo entero, docientas cincuenta libra de carne de res y cerdo. Siendo los platos que mas se venden., al comprar al mayor, le rebajan y da a precios accesibles su comida, es por eso cada dia sus ventas han crecido. El cual esta sastifecha.
texts.en:
Luisa has had her own business for the last 22 years; it’s an eatery that’s been growing thanks to the dedication she puts into her work to provide economically for her family.  Her husband works managing a firm and he contributes the money he earns with his labor.

She is the mother of three children. One’s married and two go to university.  Luisa has been very hardworking.  She started out selling fried fast food.  In time, she was able to open her dining room with the profits and then with loans from Afodenic was able to expand the dining room.  Her specialty is roasted chicken that has become very popular with her customers.

She will use this new loan to buy 250 pounds of whole chicken and 250 pounds of beef and pork since these are the dishes that sell the most.  Prices are reduced when she buys wholesale and she can then sell her dishes at affordable prices; this is why her sales have increased daily and this makes her satisfied.

loans.use: to buy chicken and meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela es soltera, tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la venta de telas de lona de diferentes colores y calidades, inició este negocio por la necesidad que tenia de mejorar su condición de vida y hasta el momento lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para ampliar su capital de trabajo para la compra de mas telas para la venta lo que es lona de diferentes colores y comercializar mas de este producto. En el futuro espera ver su negocio el mas grande del lugar donde vive.
texts.en:
Micaela, 56, is single.  She has four children.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She sells canvas in various colors and textures.  She started the business because she needed to improve her living conditions and to date has 15 years’ experience.

She decides to request a loan to increase her working capital to buy more canvas in various colors in order to sell more of this product.  In the future she hopes her business will be the largest in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make her hammocks.

loans.name: Marta Yolanda

texts.es:
La señorita Marta Yolanda es soltera, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos que aun no estudia, se dedica a la confección de tejidos, la confección de delantales típicos y camisas, inició este trabajo como operaria, y hasta ahora lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamos que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos para producir mas del trabajo que realiza, espera que su negocio crezca en el futuro.
texts.en:
Señorita Marta Yolanda is single and 22 years old.  She studied up to primary school level, and has one child who is not yet in school.  She works doing sewing, making traditional smocks and shirts.  She started in this work as an operator, and has 15 years of experience up to this point.

She is requesting a loan which she will use to buy fabric and thread for producing more items.  She hopes that her business will grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Morena tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos ya tiene tres años de realizar esta actividad, debido a que le genera ingresos considerables. Donde ella vive las calles son empedradas y valastreadas ( son tierra rocosas y disparejas), ella debe caminar a pie durante dos horas y en carro son cinco kilómetros, para ir a comprar los insumos que necesita, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. de la mañana por que hay poco transporte en la zona.

La señora Morena solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para la compra de insumos para el engorde de cerdos, estos serán: concentrado, harinilla y maíz amarillo, así como vitaminas para los cerdos recién nacidos. Además comprara dos cerdos reproductores en periodo de gestación.

Al tener el préstamo, ella podrá comprar los insumos a tiempo para el engorde de sus cerdos y crecerlos más rápido y fácil. Hoy en día ella tiene que viajar al pueblo cuatro veces por semana a comprar los insumos. De esta manera ella podrá comprar más cantidad de insumos, lo que le permitirá comprarlos a mejor precio y tendrá que viajar menos al pueblo y con el ingreso adicional planea comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de fríjol.

A ella le gustaría ahorrar de los ingresos que recibirá, para construir una mejor galera y comercializar más cerdos, ella quiere tener su granja bien establecida, puesto que en la zona no se observan cerdos de raza solo indios que no dejan mucha ganancia como el que ella cuida que es el cerdo de raza.
texts.en:
Sra. Morena is 26 years old and is a single mother with one son.

She has been raising pigs for three years because they generate a substantial income. The streets where she lives are cobbled and gravel (the ground is rocky and uneven) and she has to walk on foot for two hours, which by car is 5 kilometers, in order to buy the supplies she needs and has to get up at 4 a.m. in the morning because there is little transportation in the area.

Morena is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy supplies to fatten the pigs: this will be concentrated feed, coarsely ground wheat mixed with bran and yellow corn, as well as vitamins for the new born pigs. In addition she will buy two pregnant breeding pigs.

Upon receiving the loan she will be able to buy supplies in time to fatten her pigs and grow them more rapidly and easily. Nowadays she has to go to town four times a week to buy supplies. With the loan she will be able to buy a greater quantity of supplies which will allow her to buy at a better price and she will have to spend less time traveling. With the additional income she plans to buy agricultural supplies to plant beans.

She would like to save the income she will receive in order to build a better pig pen and market more pigs. She wants to have her farm well established since one does not see purebred pigs in the area but only native ones, which do not provide as much profit as purebred pigs.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to feed her pigs and to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Residenciales El Campo N° 2 Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Residenciales El Campo 2 está integrado por tres socias, Reina Isabel, Elbia y Santos Blacina. Las tres socias viven en Juticalpa, Olancho.  
Reina Isabel tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda, y tiene 5 hijos. Comenzó con una mini pulpería hace 12 años con un préstamo de 2,000 Lempiras.  En el 2003 tuvo un mercadito pero su esposo se enfermó y tuvo que vender su negocio para pagar los gastos médicos.  Ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano de forma ambulante.  Tiene una clientela buena y sus hijos le ayudan a vender la ropa.  Con el préstamo comprará un fardo de ropa de segundo mano de primera clase.  También usará sus ahorros para comprar tres fardos más.  Con el préstamo podrá crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias para suportar a su familia y salir adelante.  Sus sueños son que podrá construir su casa propia y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.  
Elbia vende verduras y usará el préstamo para comprar verduras por mayor y aumentar sus ganancias.
Santos Blacina vend productos cosméticos y con el préstamo comprará más productos cosméticos para crecer su inventario y aumentar sus ganancias para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group “Residenciales El Campo 2” consists of three members:  Reina Isabel, Elbia, and Santos Blacina.  

Reina Isabel is 50 years old, widowed, and has five children.  She started a mini-market 12 years ago with a loan of 2000 HNL.  In 2003, she was operating her small business until her husband became ill.  Reina had to sell the business in order to pay his medical expenses.  Now she sells secondhand clothing as a street vendor.  She has a good customer base and her children help with selling clothes.  Her loan will be used to buy a bundle of first-rate used clothes.  She will also use her savings to buy three additional bundles.  This loan will enable her to grow her business and increase her income so that she can support her family and move them forward.  Her dreams include building her own home and seeing her children continue their studies.  

Elbia sells vegetables and will use her loan to buy vegetables in bulk so that she can increase her earnings.

Santos Blacina sells cosmetics and will use her loan to buy more of these products so that she can grow her inventory and increase her earnings to help her move forward.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of used clothing.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora MatilD. es casada, tiene 42 años D. edad, cursó los grado D. educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3 D. los cuales estudian, se dedica al comercio a la venta D. ropa para todas las edades, inició este negocio como trabajadora para otro negocio, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia.

Solicita un dinero como préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio para la compra D. mas mercadería suéteres, playeras, lencería, pants, camisetas, etc. En el futuro espera ver su negocio con venta mayor.
texts.en:
MatilD. is 42 years old, married, and completed her primary education.  She has four children, three of whom are in school.  MatilD. sells clothes for all ages.  She started this business while working for another business.  She now has ten years experience.

MatilD. is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  She will buy more merchandise (sweaters, t-shirts, underwear, pants, etc).  In the future, she hopes that her business will experience more sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Jose  Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto esta  casado con la  señora  San Juana  y   tienen   ya   treinta  y   cinco   años   juntos   y  han  formado  un a   bonita   familia,  actualmente  ellos  se  dedican  a  atender   una  tienda   de abarrotes , la  cual  les  a permitido  salir  adelante  día    con día,  ellos  están  muy  contentos  por  habernos   encontrado  ya  que  los  apoyaremos   en la realización de  su proyecto,  el cual  consiste  en  realizar  la compra  de  mercancía  para  su tienda ya  que  desean   tener  en  inventario  los  diferentes  productos  que   les  demandan   sus clientes   así como también  seguir  brindado  el  excelente   servicio  que   los caracteriza.
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto is married to Sra. San Juana. They have been together for 35 years and have formed a beautiful family. Roberto currently manages a grocery store, which allows him to move forward day after day. He is pleased to have contacted Credituyo for assistance with completing his project.

Roberto plans to buy merchandise for his store. He wants to have an inventory of different products so that he can meet the demands of his customers and continue providing the excellent service for which he is known.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Norma  Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Norma es una persona trabajadora  y  responsable , con  esfuerzo  día  con  día    pudo adquirir   su casa , ella  se  preocupa por  brindarles a   sus pequeños   hijos   la mejor estabilidad, es  por  ello  que   se acerco  con  nosotros  para    realizar  su proyecto  ,  el cual consiste   en    ampliar   la  plata  baja  de su  casa, ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad  de  ofrecer  a  sus  hijos  un  excelente   patrimonio  , además  de  que  sus   familiares  y  amigos  estén  mas  cómodos   cuando  la  visitan,  es  por  ello  que esta   agradecida  por  habernos  encontrando.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma is a hardworking and responsible person who has strived each day to acquire her house. She worries about providing her young children greater stability. For this reason, she has approached Credituyo about completing her project. She wants to expand the first floor of her house, so she sees this loan as a possibility of providing her children a great inheritance.

In addition, her relatives and friends will be more comfortable whenever they visit her. For this reason, she is thankful for having contacted Credituyo.

loans.use: to expand the ground floor of her house.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder, de 38 años de edad, originario de Estelí, esta casado, padre de 3 hijos, el es comerciante, es dueño de una mini tienda. Anteriormente el trabajaba en una abarrotería pero después se decidió poner su propio negocio, donde vende mercadería de todo tipo como ropa, zapato, cosméticos,alimentos  con la ayuda de su papa dirige el negocio que hoy en día además el tiene venta de paleta de todo sabor muy deliciosas y demandas por sus clientes. 
Solicito el crédito para comprar mercadería nueva de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y productos alimenticios en general para abastecer su mini tienda. Con esta inversión pretende mejorar sus ventas, ofrecer productos de mejor  calidad, lograr mejorar su negocio pues tiene como meta lograr convertir su mini tienda convertirla en una tienda de venta de mercadería en General que le permita emplear a mas personas dentro de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Wilder is 38 years old and originally from Estelí. He is married, the father of three children, and a merchant who owns a small store. Wilder previously worked at a grocery store, but afterwards he decided to establish his own business. He sells all types of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and food with the help of his father. Today his store also sells popsicles of all delicious flavors in order to meet the demands of his customers.

Wilder is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as new clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and general food products to keep his small store stocked. With this investment he intends to improve his sales, offer products of better quality, and achieve better results in his business. His goal is to convert his small store into a general merchandise depot where he can employ more people from his community.

loans.use: to buy new clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and general food products.

loans.name: Martha  Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Martha es una persona  responsable  y  muy  trabajadora que actualmente   tiene  una tienda de abarrotes que  le  permite  obtener  ingresos  para   salir  adelante  día   con  día ,  ella esta muy contenta de habernos encontrado ya que le estamos apoyando para la  realización de   su proyecto   el cual consiste  en la  compra  de mercancía para su negocio para   poder  tener   en existencia  la mercancía   que  le  requieren  sus  clientes ,  ve  en el crédito la posibilidad   de   brindar a  su  familia  una excelente  calidad  de   vida  y  seguir  brindando a  sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio  que   los  caracteriza.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is a responsible and hardworking person who currently has a grocery store, which allows her to generate income to move forward day after day. She is very pleased to have contacted Credituyo for assistance with completing her project. She plans to buy merchandise for her business so that she will have inventory to meet the requirements of her customers.

Martha views this loan as a possibility of providing her family an excellent quality of life and continuing to offer her customers the excellent service for which she is known.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Santos Francisco

texts.es:
Santos, es originario del Espinal una comunidad localizada en Estelí, tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, el es agricultor. Inicio a la edad de 12 años ayudando a su papa y mama preparando la tierra, comercializando el producto. Hoy en día el terreno donde siembra no es propio siembra a media con un amigo, ha logrado comprar su propia casa  producto de su esfuerzo y arduo trabajo durante estos años. Pues este oficio le ha permitido sobrevivir a pesar de que no pudo estudiar por dedicarse a trabajar para poder comer. 
Realizo el préstamo para la compra de insumos y establecimiento de 5 manzanas de frijol. Esta inversión le ayudara a sacar adelante su siembra de frijoles, mejorar sus aéreas de siembra. Uno de sus objetivos es lograr comprar su terreno propio de siembra, pero su meta principal es lograr que sus hijos estudien y logren tener una  carrera universitaria mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is originally from Espinal, a community in the town of Estelí. He is 33 years old, has two children, and works as a farmer. Santos started out at the age of 12, helping his father and mother with preparing the land and selling their products. Today he plants crops, but he does not own the land on which they are planted. He and a friend plant crops together. Santos was able to buy his own house as a result of the effort and hard work he has put in all these years. His work has enabled him to survive. Even though he was not able to attend school, Santo has been dedicated to his work so that he could feed himself.

With this loan, Santos will buy supplies so that he can establish five plots of beans. This investment will help him move forward with his planting and improve his crop. One of his goals is to buy his own land for planting, but his main objectives are to provide an education for his children, help them achieve a university degree, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for planting five plots of beans.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит на увеличение ассортимента товара продовольственной группы. На дополнительную прибыль она планирует приобрести холодильную камеру.  Светлана планирует расширять свой бизнес и по возможности открыть еще одну точку. 

Светлана проживает с мужем в своем доме. С предыдущего кредита смогла улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en: Svetlana is asking for a loan to increase the range of her commodities. With the additional income, she plants to buy a refrigerated room. Svetlana plans to expand her business and, if possible, open another outlet. Svetlana lives with her husband in their home. With a previous loan she was able to better her living standards.

loans.use: Increase her range of goods

loans.name: Lomas De San Pedro (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Lomas De San Pedro se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio las Palmas D. Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace 4 meses decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha sido de gran ayuda ya que han podido incrementar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Holandina, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga para ayudarse y ayudar a su marido con los gastos D. hogar hace mas de 20 años puso un pequeño negocio en su casa en el cual se dedica a la venta de golosinas, helados, bebidas, ciertos bocadillos y comidas rápidas, ella también en su local ofrece entretenimiento ya que tiene cuatro mesas de billar hasta donde llegan sus clientes con la finalidad de entretenerse y disfrutar de un momento ameno,  trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo cuando él puede, nos cuenta que los fines de semana es cuando más clientes llegan hasta su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su negocio va a comprar helados, gaseosas, golosinas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde que inicio y le gusta cómo trabaja la institución. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Lomas de San Pedro” (The Hills of San Pedro) meets every 15 days at the site of Las Palmas in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received national and international recognition. This place is famous for its straw hats.

Four months ago, this group of individuals decided to join together and start this Communal Bank. Their union has been a great help in growing their small businesses. They engage in different business activities such as retail, services, selling food, and other trades.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Holandina. She is 56 years old, married, and has five grown children who are independent. Her husband is a farmer.

To help her husband with the household expenses, Holandina has managed a small business in her home for more than 20 years. She sells candy, ice cream, beverages, and certain snacks and fast foods. Holandina also provides entertainment at her establishment since she has four billiard tables for customers who want to pass the time and enjoy a relaxing moment. She works every day and has the help of her husband whenever he is able. Holandina says that the weekends are when most of her customers come to her shop.

This loan will be used to restock her business by purchasing ice cream, sodas, candy, and ingredients for preparing her dishes. Holandina has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys working with the organization. Her dream is to have a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, sodas, candy, and ingredients.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora María, ella tiene 57 años de edad,  es madre soltera de  dos hijos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aún viven con ella.
 
Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario desde hace mas de 15 años tiene un bar,   en el cual además de  vender gaseosas y cervezas, también vende bocadillos y  comidas rápidas, ella nos cuenta que trabaja desde las 14h00 ya que a esa hora y en las noches acuden sus clientes a su local a conversar y distraerse un poco después de las labores diarias. Trabaja todos los días y sus hijos le ayudan en su local.

Este crédito es para comprar gaseosas, cervezas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco y le gusta los beneficios que tiene al ser socia de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local mucho más grande y un restaurante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Picoaza” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, celebrating the traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and having a rich historical culture influenced by the surrounding mountains.

Sra. María lives in this place. She is 57 years old and a single mother of two grown children. One of them still lives with her.

María has earned her daily living for more than 15 years by managing a bar where she sells sodas and beer. She also offers snacks and fast food. María says that she works from 2pm and continues through the night because that is when her customers come to her establishment to talk and find a bit of a distraction after a day of work. She works every day and her children help with managing the business.

This loan will be used to buy sodas, beer, and ingredients for preparing her dishes. María is participating in her fourth loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the benefits associated with being a member of the organization. Her dreams include having a larger establishment and a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beer, and ingredients.

loans.name: Cruz Magdalena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora  Cruz, ella tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes.  Su marido es chofer y comerciante.

Ella y su esposo se dedican a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, recorren la ciudad y los campos en una camioneta que es de su propiedad y que les permite desplazarse por muchos lugares donde realizan las ventas, las mismas que son al contado aunque también deja a crédito pero solo a personas conocidas y de confianza, trabajan los viernes, sábados y domingos, la mercadería la compran en Guayaquil ya que su hijo vive allá, él les da comprando y se las envía por transporte de cooperativa.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y  le gusta porque los intereses son bien bajos. 

Su sueño es tener su propio almacén para vender en un lugar estable.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Picoaza” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, celebrating the traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and having a rich historical culture influenced by the surrounding mountains.

Sra. Cruz lives in this place. She is 52 years old, married, and has three children who are grown and independent. Her husband is both a chauffeur and a merchant.

Cruz and her husband sell all types of clothing. They travel to the city and the rural areas in a truck that they own. This enables them to reach many places in order to make sales. They sell their products for cash but they also extend credit only to people that they know and trust. Cruz and her husband work Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. The merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil, which is where her son lives. Her son buys the merchandise and then sends it to her via transportation provided by a cooperative.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing. Cruz has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys being a member because the interest rates are very low. Her dream is to have her own store so that she can sell from a stable place of business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Nury Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nury, tiene 52 años de edad, hace varios años el compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo sola con sus tuvo 5 hijos que tuvo de esta relación, en la actualidad 4 de ellos ya son mayores de edad, el ultimo que tiene 16 años es el que aun vive con ella y estudia en colegio.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario y con esto sacar adelante a sus hijos hace 15 años empezó un negocio de venta de ropa, el cual lo ha mantenido hasta la fecha y es a través de este negocio que ha podido salir adelante,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también tiene muchos clientes que le encargan sus productos con anticipación, trabaja de miércoles a domingo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra los días sabados. Ella compra en Guayaquil cada fin de mes o cuando necesita mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado con los créditos para sacar adelante su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son terminar su casa y construir un pequeño local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Picoaza” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, celebrating the traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul, and having a rich historical culture influenced by the surrounding mountains.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Nury. She is 52 years old. Her companion in life died several years ago and she was left alone with their five children. Four of them are now adults. The youngest one is 16 years old, lives with her, and attends school.

Nury has been able to earn her daily living and move her children forward because of the clothing business she started 15 years ago. She has been able to keep her business running through today and it allows her to stay ahead. Her sales are made by going door-to-door, but she also has many customers who order their products in advance. Nury works Wednesday through Sunday. She extends credit for her products and collects payment on Saturdays. Nury goes shopping in Guayaquil at the end of every month or whenever she needs merchandise.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing. Nury is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the help the loans have provided so that she can keep her business moving. Her dreams are to finish the construction of her house and to build a small store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy trousers, t-shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete renovations to his business facility

loans.name: Doris Nilsa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

La señora  Doris es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 51  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo,  sabanas y cortinas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja tres días a la semana y esto lo hace a cualquier hora ya que no tiene horarios fijos, ella a deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la compra en Picoaza en un lugar que le dejan a buen precio. Tiene más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, sabanas y cortinas.

Su sueño es tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
The Picoaza Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza district in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its commerce, its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul, and for the rich cultural history enclosed in its mountains.

Mrs. Doris is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because it has lower interest rates than other lending institutions. She is 51 years old, married, and has three grown children. The youngest child still lives with her. Her husband is a driver. In order to earn her own money and help with the family's expenses, she works selling all types of clothing, sheets, and curtains. She sells door to door and also from her home to the customers who know her well. She works three days a week without a fixed schedule. She sells to her customers on credit and collects from them once a week. She buys her merchandise in Picoaza at a place that has good prices. She has been working in this business for more than 20 years and it is going very well for her.

She will use the loan to buy clothing, sheets, and curtains. Her dream is to have a big department store.

loans.use: buy clothing, sheets, and curtains

loans.name: Belen Aracely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Belén, tiene 33 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre pero de otra relación que tuvo hace años tiene 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 10 años los mismos que estudian el mayor en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su marido tiene un asadero de pollos.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse su sustento diario desde hace 5 años atrás puso un negocio en el centro de Picoaza en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y cortinas, ella trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 y por las noches  le ayuda a su marido en el negocio de venta de pollos asados en el centro de la ciudad. Nos cuenta que empezó ese negocio cuando se separó de su primer marido ya que sus hijos estaban pequeños y necesitaban  muchas cosas y que gracias a su negocio pudo sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños, ropa  interior,  sabanas y cortinas.  Lleva cinco años en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Picoaza Community Bank meets every other week in the Picoaza district in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its commerce, its traditional celebrations for Saint Peter and Saint Paul, and for the rich cultural history enclosed in its mountains.

Here we find Mrs. Belén. She is 33 years old and in a common-law marriage. She has three children from a different man from many years ago. Her children are 15, 11, and 10. The oldest studies in high school and the younger two study at a different school. Her husband has a rotisserie grill for chickens.

To make her daily living, she started a business 5 years ago in downtown Picoaza selling all types of clothing, sheets, and curtains. She works every day from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm and at night she helps her husband with his business selling roasted chicken downtown in the city. She shared that she began this business when she separated from her first husband since her children were small and needed a lot of things, and that thanks to her business, she was able to help her family get ahead.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, underwear, sheets, and curtains. She has been in the community bank for five years and she likes it because it was thanks to her first loan that she began her business. Her dream is that her children never want for anything.

loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothing, underwear, sheets, and curtains.

loans.name: Daysi Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora Daysi, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 14 y 12 años de edad las mismas que estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante. Ella es licenciada en Ciencias de la Educación y trabaja por contrato en una escuela en Santa Ana.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que además de impartir sus conocimientos en la escuela en la cual trabaja también se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días, y los fines de semana vende por su localidad y también les vende a sus compañeras y conocidas en su trabajo, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
>
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank Picoaza meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, an area known for its commercial activities, for the traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history found in its mountains. 

In this place lives Daysi who is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two daughters aged 14 and 12 who both go to school. Her spouse is a merchant. She is licensed in Educational Sciences and is a contractual worker in the Santa Ana school. 

She is a very hardworking woman who, besides sharing her knowledge in the school where she works, also works in the commercial sector. She sells clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories).
