She works every day, and on the weekends she sells in her local area and she also sells to her friends and co-workers. She gives credit and collects every week or every 15 days. She’s been engaged in this business for two years, and it’s going very well. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and all types of clothing. She has been in the communal bank for two years. She is the treasurer of the bank, and she enjoys it because the payments are easy to make. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Mercedes Giannine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Picoaza  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 9 y 8 años que  estudian en escuela. El marido es militar.
 
Ella para ganarse algo por su cuenta y para entretenerse se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende granos como: arroz, azúcar, maní, lenteja, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes, allí también vende tarjetas y realiza recargas telefónicas lo cual le deja ingresos extra, dice que esta es una forma de ganarse algo sin salir de su casa y estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus pequeños hijos. Tiene dos años con su negocio  y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, maní, lenteja entre otras cosas. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta porque con los créditos ha logrado aumentar más su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The communal bank Picoaza meets every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, an area known for its commercial activities, for the traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the rich cultural history found in its mountains. 

Here lives Mercedes. She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children aged 10, 9, and 8 who study in school. Her husband is in the military. 

In order to earn something of her own and to entertain herself, she works in commerce. She has a shop in her home in which she sells grains such as rice, sugar, peanuts, lentils, and other things. She works every day from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She says she has many clients. She also sells phone cards and recharges phones, giving her extra income. She says that it’s a way to earn something without leaving her house and to tend to her young children’s needs. She has had this business for two years, and it’s gone very well. 
 
This loan is to buy rice, sugar, peanuts, lentils, and other things. She is the founder of the communal bank, and she is the secretary of the bank. She enjoys it because the loans have allowed her to further expand her business. 

Her dream is to have a store in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, peanuts, lentils, etc

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchadoras se formó con la unión de vA. vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ella se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a día luchan por el sustento de su familia.
La Señora Bonifacia es una de las integrantes del comité, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de artículos. Todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con su trabajo. Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 3  hijos y su marido quien trabaja  como Contratista. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora Bonifacia  solicita el crédito para la compra de productos para su despensa, como ser comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y otros. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Luchadoras' committee was created when a number of neighbors from the town of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together.  The members created a very united group and are capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their team spirit.  They describe themselves as very hard-working and tenacious women who work hard every day to support their families.

Bonifacia is one of the committee's members.  She has a well-stocked store where she sells all kinds of goods.  All of her customers are very impressed with her work.  She has a very united family.  She has three children and her husband works as a contractor.  She is very happy with her business and the training sessions that her group receives.

Bonifacia is requesting this loan to buy products for her store such as food, drinks, dairy products, etc.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 53 years old and has two children. She works hard to proviD. for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Veronica has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and farming rice.

Veronica aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la Señora Laura, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el noveno ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria. 
La señora Laura tiene una despensa, comenta que diariamente se levanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, pues desde esa hora ya tiene clientes aguardándola. Comenta que la despensa es el medio por medio del cual ella mantiene a su familia y todos aquellos quienes dependen de ella. Dice que tiene mucha clientela, lo cual la anima a seguir con su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y otros para abastecer su negocio y de esa forma cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Renacer is the name of the excellent group of women formed in the city of Ita thanks to Laura, who contacted the advisor of a weekly meeting held in the area to inform herself about the type of work done by the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.  Once advised about the program, she managed to bring together 16 women who now find themselves working together very comfortably and in solidarity in their ninth cycle.

Laura has a grocery store.  She comments that she gets up very early to open her business, since from that time on she already has customers waiting for her.  The grocery store is how she supports her family and everyone who depends on her.  She says she has lots of customers, which encourages her to continue with her business.

She is requesting the loan to buy food, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other items to stock her business and so fulfill her obligations to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, baked goods, drinks, and other food.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
San Sebastian se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, desde el año 2010, gracias a que la actual Directora Finanzas la Señora Julia contactó con la asesora para pedirle una reunion para el nuevo grupo que estaban conformando en el barrio, logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el tercer ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La señora Julia, es quien se encarga de la parte financiera del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, y otros. Mediante esto ella logra tener los ingresos necesarios para mantener a todo su familia. Comenta que lleva un tiempo en esto por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, remeras, y otros, para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da a su microempresa.
texts.en:
San Sebastian is the name of this excellent group of women.  The group was founded in the city of Ita in 2010, thanks to the current Finance Director, Señora Julia.  She contacted the counselor to ask to set up a new group which was put together in the neighborhood.  She managed to bring together 17 women who find themselves enjoying their work.  They are in their third lending cycle, and are united and committed to each other through the program.

Señora Julia is in charge of the financial affairs of the group.  She works selling all types of clothing, such as trousers, shirts, T-shirts and other things.  Through this she has been able earn the income necessary to support her whole family.  She comments that it has taken a while, but she has a well defined customer base.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of trousers, shirts, T-Shirts and other things for later sale.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it is giving to her micro-business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, T-shirts, and other things for later sale.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través D. dos D. las miembros, quienes se había acercado hasta la Oficina D. la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras,  las mismas invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo D. vida, son 18 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Rogelia, ella se dedica a la venta D. comestibles D. todo tipo, nos comenta que su jornada D. trabajo empieza a muy tempranas horas, pues se levanta a preparar todos los alimentos que va a vender, ya que desea vender a sus clientes siempre productos frescos. Además D. eso dice que tiene muchos clientes, lo cual le genera buenos ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. carne, pollo, condimentos, panificados, huevos y otros insumos necesarios para la elaboración D. los alimentos que ella venD..
texts.en:
This committee was created by two of its members who approached Fundación Paraguaya's Office to find out more about the 'Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) Program.  They invited their friends and acquaintances from their neighborhood to work together as a group in order to get ahead and improve their lifestyles.  The committee has 18 members.  They are all hard-working, modest women who must earn a living every day.

One of the members of this committee is Rogelia, whose business is selling all kinds of food.  She tells us that her workday starts very early in the morning.  She must get up early in order to prepare all the food that she will sell that day as she likes to make sure that she always sells fresh food to her customers.  She tells us that she has a lot of customers and this makes her good income.  

Rogelia is requesting this loan to buy meat, chicken, seasonings, baked goods, eggs and other supplies she needs to make the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, seasonings, baked goods, eggs and other supplies for making food

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married with two children.  With both children in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to her general store. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items for her general store.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has three children, aged 6, 11 and 14 years.

In 2010, Salamatu established her rice, sugar and salt business. She began her business because she learned it from her foster parent who brought her up. Salamatu's business is so special as it has faster turnover and generates more income. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leone (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase flour (20 bags @ Le 200,000). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to construct a dwelling house, educate her children and establish a savings account. She travels to Freetown to buy stock twice per month by public vehicle. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase flour (20 bags @ Le200,000).

loans.name: Claudia Simona

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos, es una persona luchadora y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Poncaya en el municipio de Catacamas.

Claudia se dedica a la compra-venta de ganado. Ella empezo a dedicarse a esta actividad cuando su esposo por dificultades economicas tuvo que salir del pais y se fue a buscar el sueño americano. Como mujer se le hace un tanto dificil el manejo del ganado pero aun asi no se deja vencer por las adversidades. Claudia se levanta todos los dias muy temprano por las mañanas para iniciar las actividades del cuidado del ganado y una vez que las vacas alcanzan un peso adecuado, las vende a comerciantes. 

Claudia necesita el prestamo para comprar vacas lecheras, ya que es temporada de lluvia y quiere aprovechar para vender leche y luego vender las vacas para destazo.

Su meta es sacar adelante su negocio para seguir dandole el estudio a sus dos hijas mayores y ahorrar un poco para cuando sus otros dos hijos crezcan y vayan a la escuela. Claudia tiene tres ciclos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente y espera hacerlo tambien con este prestamo.
texts.en:
Claudia is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hardworking woman, and she lives with her family in the town of Poncaya, in the municipality of Catacamas. 

Claudia’s work is buying and selling cattle. She began this work when her spouse, due to financial hardship, had to leave the country and left to find the American dream. As a woman she finds livestock management a little difficult, but she is not one to give in to adversity. Claudia gets up early in the morning each day to begin her chores to care for the cattle, and as soon as they reach a healthy weight, she sells them to retailers. 

Claudia needs the loan to buy dairy cows because it’s the rainy season and she wants to use the milk and then sell the cows to be butchered. 

Her goal is to be successful in her business in order to continue sending her two older daughters to school and to save a little for when her other children grow up and go to school. Claudia has had three loan cycles with FAMA. She has been prompt in her repayments on time and hopes to do the same with this loan.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. One of her sons is a worker with a decent salary. Sameera wants to make interior improvements to her house such as fixing doors and windows, changing tiles etc, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the renovation, so she needs to take out a loan in the amount of $350 from FATEN. When Sameera gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for the necessary interior improvements to her house which will provide better living conditions for her and her family. Sameera is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for interior improvements to her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new computer.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Samar is a 33-year-old young woman (she is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead). She is married and has two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver making a low income; it is the only source of income the family has. Samar wants to help her husband with painting and licensing expenses for the taxi by taking out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Samar gets the loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to share with her husband in paying for painting and licensing the taxi. This will make the taxi more efficient and her husband will work extra hours to get better income and provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to pay for painting and licensing the taxi.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan is a 34-year-old lady who got married at the age of 19. She gave birth to two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a humble employee who receives an average salary at one of the Jordanian companies. Getting married at a young age and having children did not allow her to start her own business until recently, when she have decided to turn her artistic talent and vision into something physicA. by embroidering clothes such as Abaya and covers using different kinds and colors of beads. Now Sawsan has applied for a loan in order to expand her business and add new types of accessories on the clothes so she can one day have her own exhibition.

loans.use: to add new types of accessories on clothes.

loans.name: Sabria

texts.en:
Sabria is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has four sons and two daughters; one of her sons is employed with a decent salary. 

Sabria has a beauty salon and wants to purchase a new beauty salon kit such as hair products, creams, chairs, mirrors, etc., in order to improve her work. The amount of money Sabria has isn't enough to pay for it, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Sabria gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase a new beauty salon kit and improve her work positively; in this way, she will increase her income and live in better life conditions with the family. Sabria is photographed in her salon.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a new beauty salon kit to improve her work.

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en: Niveen is a 26-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Niveen has a project of raising laying hens and benefits from selling its products. Niveen wants to purchase more laying hens and expand her project to increase the family income. She has an amount of money that is not enough to pay for the hens, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Niveen gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase more laying hens and increase her income by selling more of their products; this will provide Niveen and her family with better life conditions. Niveen is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase more laying hens.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Regina. She is married and has two children, aged 5 and 8. In 2006, Regina established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to get a permanent source of income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leone leone (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Regina has already received and successfully repaid a loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy different kinds of clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Regina plans to open her business in other areas within her township, hopes to grow to general overseer of her business and care for the needs of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for purchasing new carpentry tools.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 30 year old young woman. She is married and has two sons, her husband is a branch manager in a Palestinian association with a decent salary. 

Alaa' wants to start a new project of her own to increase the family income and assist her husband in paying for their life expenses. She wants to open a beauty salon and wants to purchase a new beauty salon kit such as: chairs, mirrors, hair creams, different types of hair brushes, etc. Alaa' has an amount of money which is not enough to pay for these supplies. She needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase all of the supplies needed to start her beauty salon. This will enable Alaa' to start her project and increase her income to have better life conditions. Alaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Amany

texts.en: Amany is a 21 year old young woman. She is married and has one son; her husband is employed with a decent salary.Amany wants to start a new project of a beauty salon and she needs to purchase a new beauty salon kit, such as: chairs, mirrors, hair creams, hair brushes, etc. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan amount of $2,000 from FATEN. When Amany gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will pay to purchase new beauty salon kit and open her project successfully, this will enable her to get better income and live in better life conditions. Amany is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase a new beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en: Ibraheem is a 54 year old man. He is married and has four sons and three daughters. Two of his sons are workers with decent salaries. Ibraheem wants to share with his son in his wedding expenses. In order to pay part of these expenses, the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan amount of $2,000 from FATEN. When Ibraheem gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to take part in his son's wedding expenses and share, with his son, in paying for the wedding. Ibraheem will be able to help his son to prepare well for his wedding and to provide better life conditions for the family. Ibraheem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for his son wedding expenses.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
The 45 year old mother, Huda, has 8 daughters and 1 son. Her husband has already retired. In order to support this big family, Huda has worked in many fields with her husband, such as private teacher (home schooling), selling blankets, olive oil cans and cheese, each by its season.

Besides all her previous endeavors, Huda has been working as a tailor for 6 years, now at her house. She has applied for a loan to buy more material that will help her increase her productivity so that she can open her own tailoring workshop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more material and fabric to increase her productivity so she can open her own tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она реализует мужскую верхнюю одежду на одном из местных рынков, который называется «Образцовый». Людмила занимается торговлей данным видом товара уже на протяжении 8 лет. Направление в бизнесе помогли в свое время выбрать друзья. Сейчас у нее в обороте 8 000 гривен, прибыль составляет 3 000 гривен. 

Людмила никогда не сидит на месте и не останавливается на достигнутом. Она постоянно стремится все дальше развивать свой бизнес. На этот раз она планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 8 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар к осенне-зимнему сезону, а именно приобрести мужские куртки для последующей продажи в своем киоске на рынке. За счет получения дополнительной прибыли, клиент планирует газифицировать свой дом.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Ludmila is a businesswoman from Melitopol. She sells men's outerwear on one of the local markets which name is Obraztsoviy (Exemplary). Ludmila sells the merchandise for eight years. In the past, her friends aided her in choosing the direction in business. Right now she has 8,000 hrivna of working capital and her profit is 3,000 hrivna. Ludmila never sits in one plane and does not stop at what she has achieved. She constantly seeks on how to further develop her business. This time she is planning to use the 8,000 hrivna loan from Kiva to buy merchandise for the autumn and winter season, precisely to buy men's jackets for future resale in her kiosk on the market. She plans to use the earned profit to install gas equipment in her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the autumn-winter season, precisely mens jackets to sell in own kiosk on the market

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.ru:
Екатерина с мужем и двумя вхрослыми дочерьми живет в Мелитополе. Она занимается продажей женской одежды на местном привокзальном рынке. Свое дело Екатерина начала еще 12 лет назад. На данный момент у нее в товар вложено 40 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет 5 000 гривен. 

Екатерина планирует приобрести сезонный товар: женскую одежду на осень-зиму и реализовать его по приемлемым ценам. Предприимчивость и умение правильно вести бизнес помогут Екатерине осуществить свои цели и продолжить расширять свой бизнес, открывая новые точки реализации в будущем. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Yekaterina and her husband with two grown daughters live in Melitopol. She sells women's clothing on the local market near the train station. Yekaterina started her business twelve years ago. At this time she has 40,000 hrivna invested in her merchandise. Her clean profit is 5,000 hrivna.

Yekaterina plans to buy seasonal merchandise: women's clothing for the autumn and winter season and to sell it at reasonable prices. Her entrepreneurship and ability to run her business correctly allow Yekaterina to realize her goals and continue to expand her business by opening new locations to sell in the future.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise: women's clothing for the autumn and winter season and sell it at reasonable prices

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга замужем, у нее двое взрослых детей. Она живет и работает в городе Мелитополе. Ольга занимается продажей женской одежды и обуви на центральном рынке города. В этом бизнесе она уже около 17 лет и считает, что нашла приемлемое для себя направление. На данный момент у нее в товаре 60 000 гривен, чистая прибыль составляет 7 000 гривен. 

Ольге необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести сезонную женскую одежду, увеличить ассортимент товара и на дополнительную прибыль улучшить быт. В будущем Ольга надеется планомерно расширять свой бизнес и по возможности открыть еще одну торговую точку. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Olga is married and has two grown children. She lives and works in the city of Melitopol. Olga sells women's apparel and footwear in the central town market. She has been engaged in this business for nearly 17 years and believes that she has found an acceptable direction. At this point, she has 60,000 hryvnia worth of goods and her net income was 7,000 hryvnia.

Olga needs a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to buy seasonal women's clothing, to increase the range of products and to raise additional income to improve her household. In the future, Olga hopes to gradually expand her business and possibly open another outlet.

loans.use: to buy seasonal women's clothing, to increase the range of products and to raise additional income to improve her household.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive por la parroquia de Ricaurte lugar donde existe una gran variedad de comedores que ofrecen los platos típicos del sector, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales,  mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres.

La Señora. María tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 17 años de edad que está  estudiando en la universidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña María tiene una una tienda de comestibles hace 6 años, en la cual labora desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 6 años y los créditos le han permitido crecer en su negocio. El dinero de este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites y otros productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.

Su meta es que su hijo se gradué de la universidad y sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Flores communal bank. She lives in the Ricaurte parish, an area where there are a great variety of eateries that serve regional dishes. The locals work in agriculture and breed animals, maintaining the traditions and culture of their parents. 

María is 46 years old and is a single mother of one 17 year old son who studies in the university. She doesn’t have her own home and lives with her parents with whom she shares the household costs. 

María has had a grocery store for 6 years, and she works from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. 

She has been in the communal bank for 6 years, and the loans have allowed her to grow her business. She will invest the money from this loan into the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, oils, and other essential products for her store. 

Her goal is that her son will graduate from the university and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oils, and other essential products

loans.name: Yenny Melania

texts.es:
La Señora. Yenny es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una belleza arquitectónica, cultural y natural que cautiva a propios y extraños, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y muy cordial.

La Señora. Yenny tiene 32 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 10, 9 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y labora en un taller que es de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros de manera independiente.

Doña Yenny trabaja en una panadería medio día de lunes a sábados y lleva 8 meses en esta labor. El resto de su tiempo trabaja en la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal y lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra reingresando y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería para incrementar su mercadería. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Yenny is a member of the Las Flores communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city which has beautiful architecture, culture and nature that captivates both locals and visitors, and has a great variety of cuisine, and people who are friendly and cordial. 

Yenny is 32 years old, and she and her husband have three children who are 10, 9, and 2 years old. Their first two children study in a small school in the city. Her spouse is a professional mechanic, and he works in a shop that he owns. They don’t have their own home, and so they live with her parents in law independently. 

Yenny works in a bakery from noon on Monday until Saturday. She has done this work for eight months. In the remainder of her time she works selling Yanbal brand cosmetics, and she’s been in that business for one year. 

She has re-joined the communal bank, and she will invest her new loan in the purchase of perfume, creams, cosmetics, and imitation jewelry to increase her merchandise. 

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and imitation jewelry

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que tiene una belleza arquitectónica, cultural y natural que cautiva a propios y extraños, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y muy cordial.

Doña Zoila tiene 50 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos, cuatro de ellos son casados e independientes y su ultima hija que tiene de 10 años de edad está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Zoila se dedica a la venta de frutas por mayor y menor, tiene un puesto propio y lleva 25 años en el negocio, trabaja de domingo a domingo empezando su jornada de trabajo desde las 3 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para continuar con el negocio.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the communal bank "Las Flores."  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that has an architectural, cultural and natural beauty that captivates both locals and foreigners.  The city has great variety in its cuisine, and friendly and cordial people.

Zoila is a 50 year-old widow.  From her marriage she has 5 children, 4 of whom are married and independent.  Her youngest daughter, 10, is studying in a small school in the city.  She owns the house that she lives in.

Zoila has a business selling fruit at retail and wholesale.  She has her own stall, and she has been in this business for 25 years.  She works every day, starting her working day at 3 in the morning and working until 7 at night.

This is the first loan that she has taken with her communal bank.  She joined the bank at the invitation of her sister-in-law.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of fruits so that she can continue with her business.

Her goal is to buy herself a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Laura Alejandrina

texts.es:
La Señora. Laura es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos típicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

Doña Laura tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 14, 13, 10 y 2 años de edad, 2 estudian en el colegio y 1 en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo  labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Laura se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, ella tiene cuyes, pollos y en especial ganado, ella arrienda potreros para alimentar su ganado. Trabaja en esta labor ya que le da el tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es comprar potreros para criar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the communal bank "La Esquina."  She lives in the Sinincay parish.  Here one can find beautiful places to observe nature, a great variety of traditional dishes, and people who maintain their culture and traditions.  The people here are known for their kindness and friendliness.

Laura is 34 years old and married.  Her marriage has produced 4 children who are now aged 14, 13, 10 and 2.  Two of the children are in school, and one is in an elementary school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  They own the home that they live in.

Laura has a business raising and selling animals.  She raises guinea pigs, chickens, and especially cattle.  She rents pasture lands to feed her livestock.  She does this type of work because it gives her time to care for her children.

She has been a member of her communal bank for 5 years, and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of feed for her animals.

Her goal is to buy pasture land so that she can raise more livestock.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Hilda Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Hilda es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Miraflores, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos típicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

La Señora. Hilda tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 6, 2 años de edad y una bebé de 7 meses, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive con sus suegros y comparten los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Hilda se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que aun están pequeños y como pasa en casa le da la oportunidad de criar pollos.
 
Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y su alimento. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda is a member of the communal bank La Esquina. She lives in the parish of Miraflores. This parish has some beautiful spots where you can observe nature, a great variety of local dishes as well as friendly and kind people who maintain their culture and traditions.

Señora Hilda is 23 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She has 3 children, 6 and 2 years of age and a 7 month old baby. Her first child attends a small school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not own their own house and so live with their in-laws and share the household expenses.

Señora Hilda takes care of her children at home as they are still small and this gives her the opportunity of raising chickens.

This is her third loan with the communal bank and with it she is going to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Miraflores, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos típicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

Doña Rosa tiene 60 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, uno es casado e independiente y su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría pollos, cerdos y cuyes. También tiene una tienda de comestibles en la cual trabaja sin un horario fijo y de domingo a domingo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y lo va a invertir para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.

Su meta es crecer y agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the communal bank La Esquina. She lives in the parish of Miraflores. This parish has some beautiful spots where you can observe nature, a great variety of local dishes as well as friendly and kind people who maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña Rosa is 60 years old, married and has 2 children who are both adults; one is married and independent whilst her daughter is single and works, helping her mother economically. Her husband works as a daily labourer. The house they live in is their own property.

Señora Rosa takes care of her household chores and so as she spends time at home she raises chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She also has a grocery store where she works without a fixed schedule Sunday to Sunday.

She is in her 4th loan cycle with the communal bank and with it she is going to purchase rice, sugar, oils, detergents, noodles and other staple products for her store.

Her goal is to grow her business and enlarge her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, detergents and other staple products

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married with 6 children, is 48 years old and lives in Danlugan, Pagadian City.

Dolores has a  business buying and selling livestock, and earns approximately PHP 35,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 35,000 to purchase a goat and cow for her business.

Dolores has been a member of PMPC for more than 5 years. And in the future, Dolores hopes to have her own Piggery.

loans.use: to purchase a goat and cow for her livestock business

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
The Tunas Mekar Asih group has had five loans. This loan is again used to support their efforts in breeding pigs. Three members of the group stopped for various reasons: some moved away with their husbands, others already have enough capital so they do not need to borrow any more. 

Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy three piglets. Currently the price of piglets is very expensive, 500,000 Rupiah (IDR) per piglet. She and the other members of the Tunas Mekar Asih group hope the loan amount in the next period can be increased so that their businesses can develop. Ni Ketut and the rest of the group members hope this effort will advance their businesses so that they can become independent and not need to borrow any more.

loans.use: To buy three piglets

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
San Valentin es el comité integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas ellas son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, las cuales la ayudan con el sustento de su familia. Lograron formar un grupo que trabaja en equipo, siempre dentro de un marco de respeto y mutuo apoyo.
Una de las miembros es la señora María, ella se dedica hace un tiempo a la cría y posterior venta de animales. Este ha sido el sustento de su familia por un tiempo, con el mismo logra darles las condiciones mínimas para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Comenta que es un trabajo muy duro y sacrificado, pues requiere mucho esfuerzo físico.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales pequeños para la posterior venta y como así también alimento para los mismos.
texts.en:
The 'San Valentin' committee has ten [female] members who all come from the town of Santaní.  They are all neighbors and friends from this town.  All of the members have their own individual business activities which help them to support their families.  They managed to create a group where they work as a team, within a framework of respect and mutual support.

One of the members of this committee is María, who raises and sells animals.  This has been the source of support for her family for some time.  Through her business, she manages to provide her family with the minimum conditions for a decent life without hardship.  She tells us that it is very hard work as it requires a lot of physical effort.

María is requesting this loan to buy animals which she will later sell.  She will also buy feed for the animals.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is 58 years old and is married. They are blessed with 10 children. The youngest two are in school and are about to finish college this year. Faustina’s husband is a farmer, planting rice and corn in the Philippines.

Faustina is engaged in a hog raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. She has six heads of sow and 40 piglets to raise. Sometimes, Faustina has difficulties in feeding her plenty of pigs, that’s why she decided to request a loan of P50,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs. She plans also to buy galvanized iron to repair the roof top of her piggery house.

She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well, and gain higher income to save some of it for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Pigy Lestari group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 10,000,000 Rupiah (IDR); each member will receive 1,000,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these women's common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in learning the best practices for pig raising. 

Ni Komang is the head of the Pigy Lestari group. She is married and has one child, who is already married. Her husband earns money as a farmer, but Ni Komang would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to fix her kitchen and increase her savings.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní se unieron con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. Ellas desean que sus hijos y familiares no tengan que pasar por las mismas privaciones que ellas, es por eso que deciden organizarse y entrar al programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Matilde, ella se dedica a la carnicería, en su negocio vende todo tipo de cortes de carnes. Comenta que lleva un tiempo en esto, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre acuden hasta ella. Por medio de este negocio ella logra salir y sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes de carnes, costillas vacunas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta les brinda como grupo.
texts.en:
13 women from the city of Santaní came together with the plan of helping their families through their work.  They want their children and relatives not to have to go through the same privations that they have done, and this is why they have decided to organize themselves and enter Fundación Paraguaya's program for entrepreneurial women.

One of the group's members is Señora Matilde.  She works as a butcher, selling all types and cuts of meat.  She comments that it has taken a while, but she has a solid customer base who always go to her.  By means of this business, she has been able to succeed and move her family ahead in life.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cuts of meat, beef ribs, and more, with which she can stock up and meet her customers' orders.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity which is being provided to this group.

loans.use: to buy cuts of meat for later sale.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Alegria” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ellas comentan que se unieron con el propósito de poder generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ana, ella se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de animales. Este trabajo lo realiza hace ya un buen tiempo, dice que esto no es tarea fácil, pues debe de estar siempre pendiente de sus animales para que no les pase nada ni les falte nada, pero comenta que es muy gratificante para ella que por medio de este trabajo logra mantener a sus familiares, pues desea darles a ellos una vida sin privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, con lo cual podrá asegurar el alimento de los mismos.
texts.en:
The “La Alegria” committee was created by several neighbors from the community of Santaní.  They created a very united group whose members are capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their team spirit.  They tell us that they came together with the goal of making more income for their families.

One of the members of this committee is Ana, whose business is raising and selling animals.  She has been in this line of work for a long time now.  She tells us that it is not easy work because she always needs to be alert to her animals' needs, so that nothing happens to them and so that there is nothing they lack.  However, she tells us that it is also rewarding because, through this work, she manages to support her family members who she would like to offer a life without hardship.

Ana is requesting this loan to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals, to ensure that they are well fed.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced animal feed

loans.name: Guljazi

texts.en:
Guljazi is 39 years old and lives with her five sons and husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her eldest three children are high school students. 

She started her business in 2008 by selling clothes at the local market. Her family members now help her to manage the business. Her business is the only income source for the family. She is a diligent and hard-working woman who says "I want to earn more profits to educate my children very well. This is my main goal of life." She is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT loan to buy more clothes and to increase her business turnover.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Probo

texts.en:
Probo is 33 years old, married and has two school aged children. His wife is a teacher who already has nine years in this service. Probo has run a hog raising business for almost seven years. He has five sow and seven pigs for fattening.

Probo is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He needs additional capital to cope with the increasing price of feed nowadays. He plans to improve his practices in taking care of his sow to gain higher profits through the piglets he sells. Probo says that this will help him uplift their living.

Probo dreams to finish their children's education till college. He has no other wealth to give to his children, other than education.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is 40 years old and lives with her children in a ger (traditional Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her two children are high school students. 

She started her business in 2006 by selling milk at the retail price. Since then she continued her business. She started her business with 500,000 MNT. Now her daily income is between 15,000 MNT to 20,000 MNT and 30-35% of this income is a net profit. With her business profit, she paid the college tuition fees of her two children. She certainly pays a lots of attention their education. 

She is a diligent woman who says "I want to give good education to my children." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her turnover capital and buy more dairy products.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products to sell

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Sayu Komang and the other members of the Teratai Indah group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families 'incomes. Through many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Sayu Komang hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan Program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs. 

Sayu Komang will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer. Ultimately, Sayu Komang hopes that increased income will enable her to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Amarjargal is 43 years old and a hard-working woman who lives with her family in an outer 'ger' district (a district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She has four children aged from 2 to 18; her spouse works at a local company, while their children are enrolled in school except their elder daughter. Their elder daughter helps her to operate the family business. 

Since 2008, Amarjargal has been operating a clothing business with two small stalls at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. When she started her business she had a lower working capital, but today it’s increased and has become 2.1 million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks). 

Amarjargal imports her clothes from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China, twice in a month. Autumn is very high shopping season in our country,  therefore she needs to buy more clothes to sell. With her business income she is planning to pay tuition fees for her daughter who studies at the state university. So Amarjargal is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes imported from Ereen to sell in the two small stalls.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in her two small stalls.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad D. Paraguarí, se reunieron un grupo D. mujeres con el fin D.  capitalizar su actividad y otras para emprender actividades productivas, D. ahí que coordinaron una reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación, el cual les resultó muy interesante por los beneficios que les otorgaría  el programa. El comité lleva por nombre San Francisco ya que las mismas viven en el barrio del mismo nombre, ellas se han caracterizado por la unidad en el grupo, su dinamismo y respeto mutuo quienes por medio D. este emprendimiento fortalecerán el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el  segundo  ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 17 emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor D. sí para aumentar sus ingresos y por enD. brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Lilian, ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. todo, negocio que le deja buenos ingresos. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo y a su duro e incansable esfuerzo ella logra mantener a su familia y paliar los gastos que diariamente surgen en el seno familiar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas D. todo tipo como ser pantalones, jeans, camisas y demás, para que D. esa forma pueda ampliar el stock D. sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
In the town of Paraguarí, a group of women joined together with the aim of capitalizing their existing businesses and, in some cases, starting new businesses.  They arranged a meeting in order to find out more about the 'Entrepreneurial Women' Program run by Fundación Paraguaya.  They were very interested in the benefits offered to them through the program.  This committee is called 'San Francisco' as its members live in a neighborhood of the same name.  The women are noted for the unity of their group, their energy and their respect for one another.  Through this undertaking, they will strengthen the links between them.  The group are currently in their second loan cycle and have an excellent record.  The group is maD. up of 17 entrepreneurial ladies who do their very best to increase their income and thereby proviD. their respective families with the very best.

One of the members of this group is Lilian.  She sells all kinds of clothing and her business makes her good income.  She tells us that, thanks to her hard work and untiring efforts, she manages to support her family and alleviate the expenses that crop up in the bosom of her family.

Lilian is requesting this loan to buy all kinds of clothing such as pants, jeans, shirts, etc. so that she can expand her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Batsaikhan is 43 years old and lives with her spouse and daughter in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger district /district without basic infrastructure/ of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her daughter studies at the local university.

Batsaikhan has been operating a clothing retail business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia since 2000. Expanding her business has led to increased profits which have enabled her to buy a small plot of land and a car and to start the work of building her house. Her spouse operates another small stall at the same market.

Batsaikhan is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ loan to purchase more clothes to sell this fall, which is the high shopping season. In the future, she wants to expand her business more, increase her working capital, and finish her housing work.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell this fall.

loans.name: Pana

texts.en:
Pana is 49 years old and lives with her daughter and husband in a house in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. All her children are living separately, except her youngest daughter. She moved to the town three years ago. She started her business two years ago by making and tailoring clothes. 

Her income is sufficient to cover the family and business costs. She makes clothes and felt covers for yurts, traditional Mongolian houses, at her home. She is a diligent woman who says "My daugther is just graduated from the school. I want to also share my work with her and inherit my business to her."

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase sewing materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité “Alegria” tiene 1 año de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, todas las miembros son vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Ellas anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
La señora Faustina es modista, se desempeña en este oficio hace ya un buen tiempo, comenta que ella realiza muy buenos trabajos, por lo cual personas del barrio y zonas aledañas acuden hasta ella para hacerle pedidos de costuras o acercarle otro tipo de trabajo. Ella dice que gracias a este trabajo y al sacrificio diario ella logra mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos diarios.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos y demás insumos necesarios para su taller de costura. Está muy agradecida con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, a ella y a todo su grupo.
texts.en:
The “Alegria” committee was formed a year ago and works with Fundación Paraguaya.  All the member are neighbors and friends from this city.  They crave a better future for their children, which is why they are working with doubled efforts to put in place what they need for their development and training.

Señora Faustina is a dressmaker.  She has been working in this trade for quite a while, and comments that she does very good work, so that people from the neighborhood and the surrounding neighborhoods come to her with their orders for sewing or bringing her other types of work.  She say that thanks to this work and her daily self-sacrifice, she has been able to support her family and cover her daily expenses.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread, and other necessary supplies for her sewing workshop.  She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are giving, both to her and to the whole group.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy silver and gold.

loans.name: Huatbek

texts.en:
Huatbek is 37 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His children are both high school students. His wife helps him to manage the family business. 

He started his business few years ago by selling flour and rice at the local market. From 2010, he started to sell foods and other items. Currently, he is also managing another business, by selling fermented mare's milk. He has livestock in the countryside. 

He is a diligent and optimistic man who says "I want to expand my business and increase my turnover." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase hay for his livestock. He planned to buy two truck loads of hay at the cost of 600,000 MNT and 20 bags of wheat at the cost of 1,000,000 MNT and finish the construction of a fence.

loans.use: To purchase hay and wheat

loans.name: Onalhan

texts.en:
Onalhan is 45 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a tradiional Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Two of his children are high school students. His wife has a job. Their other child goes to the kindergarden. 

He started his business in 1995 by selling food and other products at the local market. He is already well positioned in the market. His working capital was increased. He never took a loan from the bank. In 2010, he spent a significant amount of money for medical care. 

He is a diligent man who says "I want to expand my business and increase my turnover." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy products for his business.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a una D. las miembros. Este es un grupo muy bueno, todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y responsables. Todas las del grupo tambien todas son mujeres que siguen adelante con sus emprendimientos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y su mayor anhelo es sacar adelante sus negocios a sus hijos y tambien a ellas mismas y por tal agradecen a la Fundacion por la oportunidad que les da.
La señora Marta se dedica a la venta D. frutas, comenta que su trabajo es un poco cansador, pero le gusta lo que hace. Ella por medio D. su trabajo sacrificado ha podido salir adelante con toda su familia, ya que gracias a este trabajo ella logra mantenerlos. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre acuden a ella en busca D. las frutas que venD..
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. manzanas, piñas, bananas, duraznos y otras frutas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to one of the members.  It’s a very good group; all the women are very hardworking and responsible.  All of the members of the group are also women who continue forward with their enterprises with much effort and dedication and their greatest wish is to succeed with their businesses and move their children, as well as themselves, forward.  Because of this they thank the Fundación for the opportunity it gives them.

Marta is a fruit vendor.  She comments that her work is a bit tiring but she likes what she does.  Through her demanding work she’s been able to get ahead together with her entire family because thanks to this work she’s able to support them.  She comments that she has many customers who always seek her out in search of the fruit she sells.

She asks for the loan to buy apples, pineapples, bananas, peaches and other fruit to stock up and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fruit for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa is 50 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her three children are working in Ulaanbaatar city. Her husband used to work as a driver and has not worked since 2000. 

She graduated from the technological training center, majoring in fashion and sewing in 1980. She worked at the local fashion house as a tailor for 20 years. After she retired from work, she started her own sewing business. She has no work partner so far. In the future, she plans to expand her business operation by increasing her turnover and hiring one worker. 

She is an open-minded and hard working person who says "If I have a collateral, it would be easy for me to take bank loans and increase the business turnover. I want to expand my business very well." She is requesting a 750,000 MNT to increase her working capital and purchase cloth and materials.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and materials

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran supports her husband by operating a business sewing clothes. She learnt about this art from her mother and now she has become very skillful in her work and operating it independently. Her good sewing works allows her to receive regular orders every month. 

Her husband is involved in an agriculture profession. He is basically a farmer and works in the field. He grows different seasonal crops and sells to the required customers for profit. Nazeeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy farming supplies such as pesticides, seeds and fertilizer for the further expansion of his business. 

She is confident that an investment will help her husband get better crops and earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as pesticides, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: 03.08.85 Thiệu Toán Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Chiến works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. Chiến is 44 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 85 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives with one dependent, and works in the Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chiến has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Chiến hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 03.08.86 Thiệu Toán Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Chanh works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is 52 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. Chanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2003, Chanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She is the group leader of the 86 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Chanh hopes to maintain a successful business, to buy a motorbike, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Sarsenbek

texts.en:
Sarsenbek is 36 years old and lives with his three children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt), in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His three children are high school students. His wife stays at home. He started his business in 2001 by herding livestock in the countryside. He still owns some livestock there. 

He moved to the local area from the countryside in 2009. He has been driving a taxi from Ulgii town to Bayan-Nuur town. He owns the taxi car.  When he goes on taxi service, he earns 300,000 MNT per round trip as net profit. He goes on these trips twice a week and repairs his car once a month. 

He is a diligent and energetic man who says, "I want to expand my business and improve my life. Well, this is my life goal." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts to repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, tiene 36 años, es soltero, tiene un hijo que esta viviendo con el, vino de Asunción para trabajar en una empresa de esta ciudad, de ahí paso a abrir su propia empresa.
El tiene un local donde se dedica a la colocación y venta de parabrisas. Comenta que su negocio le genera muy buenos ingresos y que gracias a esto puede mantenerse y mantener los gastos de la casa y también a su hijo. Dice que su negocio tiene mucho éxito y que eso le genera un poco mas de ingresos, por lo cual le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en el, para que de esa forma vaya creciendo mas y mas en el mercado.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas, el cual es el elemento esencial de su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Juan, 36 years old, is single. He has one son who is living with him. He came from Asunción to work in a business from that city, and from there he opened his own business.

He has a shop where he installs and sells windshields. He says that his business generates very good profits for him, and that thanks to this he can support himself, pay the household expenses, and support his son. He says that his business is very successful and it generates a bit of profit for him. For this reason he would like to continue investing in it, so that it may grow more and more in the market.

He is asking for the loan to purchase windshields, the essential element of his business. He thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it is giving him.

loans.use: to purchase windshields to sell

loans.name: 03.08.87 Thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Thuận works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in the Thiệu Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2003, Thuận  joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 87 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

With her business profit, Thuận hopes to provide for her kid, to remodel her house, and to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Salyika's Group

texts.en:
Salyika is the leader of this group. She is 64, and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two sons and a daughter. The older son and the daughter are married and they live separately with their families. The younger son works in construction, and he lives together with his mom and takes care of her. 

Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 700 soms, Salyika started to sell milk. She sells about 40-50 liters a day and the monthly profit from the trade is about 10,000 soms. With money received from the loan, Salyika wants to purchase more milk in the village and then resell it at the higher price in the city. 

She needs some money to start repairing her house. In the future, Salyika wishes to purchase a vehicle for her younger son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more milk for resale.

loans.name: Shijir

texts.en: Shijir is 35 years old and lives with his three children and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His eldest daughter goes to high school, and his two sons go to kindergarden. His wife is currently unemployed and sometimes sells livestock. He started his business in 2007 by transporting goods and products between cities. Before, he used to drive a truck. He switched the truck for a minivan. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I do my best to bring good service to my clients. I also want to provide a good education and good living conditions for my children." He is requesting a 2,000,000-Mongolian-tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase goats.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Gricelda Paola

texts.es:
La señorita Gricelda, es de la Ciudad de Pilar. Se trata de una chica que vive hace mas de 18 años en la ciudad en casa de sus tíos. Ella es la encargada de esa casa y no paga alquiler solo corre con los gastos de servicios básicos. Esta cursando el primer año de la carrera de Administración en la Universidad Privada San Lorenzo. Trabaja como vendedora para la empresa Industria y Hogar, hace 1 año, y seis meses.
Ella es soltera, sin hijos es la mayor de dos hermanos. Los mismos son menores y viven con sus padres en España. Es una persona muy trabajadora amable y emprendedora con ganas de superarse cada día.
Ella solicita el crédito para el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, como así también para compra de libros y materiales didácticos. Ella está muy agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad, ya que lo que mas desea ella es poder seguir estudiando para terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Señorita Gricelda is from the city of Pilar. She is a young woman who has lived for more than 18 years in this city in her uncle and aunt's house. She is in charge of the house and pays no rent, only the cost of basic services. She is in her first year of an administration degree in the private University of San Lorenzo. She has worked for the last year and a half as a salesperson for the company Industria y Hogar.

She is single, without children and is the eldest sibling. Her two brothers are minors and live with her parents in Spain. She is a very hardworking, enterprising and friendly person with a desire to excel and improve every day.

She is asking for the loan to pay for her university fees as well as buy books and teaching materials. She is very grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunity as what she most wants is to be able to continue studying to complete her degree.

loans.use: to buy school supplies as well as pay for tuition and books.

loans.name: Ma.menaliza

texts.en:
Ma.Menaliza describes herself as kind, simple, and responsible. She is a mother who is now 47 years old and has three school-age children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to supplement her husband's income. Since their children are now in college, they are suffering financial shortages due to the high cost of school fees, commodities, and transportation. Despite this, they have a strong determination to uplift their standard of living and educate their children through patience and hard work. 

Motivated by this, Ma.Menaliza aimed to sell more grocery items to earn a higher income, but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for additional capital amounting to 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, chocolates, breads, beverages, noodles, soaps, and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She believes that through this loan she will be able to improve the business and increase her income to support the education of their children. In the future, she is hoping that her business will grow and their children will earn a degree.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, chocolates, breads, beverages, noodles, soaps, and seasonings to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
El Señor Juan es soltero, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en pareja con 2 hijos menores de edad, reside en la ciudad de Curuguaty, en su casa propia. 
Es propietario de una parada de Taxi, cuenta con un auto a su nombre, en cual trabaja todos los días cubriendo un itinerario de Curuguaty – Ciudad del Este. Con una experiencia de 5 años en el rubro en forma independiente, ya que antes trabajaba como personal cumpliendo la función de conductor en el mismo rubro. Los pobladores de algunos lugares optan por el servicio de Taxis ya que no hay colectivos que cubren directo. También por el confort y la rapidez.
El solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su taxi, ya que este es el medio de su trabajo y su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old and single.  He lives with his partner (unmarried) and his two dependent children.  He lives in the town of Curuguaty, in his own home.  He owns a taxi stand and has a car in his name which he uses for work every day, covering a route between Curuguaty and Ciudad del Este.  He has five years experience of working independently in this line of work.  He used to work as a driver in the same field but as a member of staff, working for somebody else.

The locals in some of these places choose to use a private taxi service as there aren't collective taxis (those with a fixed route and fare) that run direct.  They also choose a private taxi service for the comfort and speed.

Juan is requesting a loan to have his taxi serviced as it is his work tool and also his main source of income.

loans.use: to have his taxi serviced

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina, 30, a resident of Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Agapito, a welder, and mother to their two children. Both are still studying in elementary school. She and her husband manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells frozen chicken and pork. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marina hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
